title: Celebrities who have moved on quickly as Miley Cyrus calls out double standards
text:
Miley has slammed the double standards of dating in Hollywood (Picture: Getty)

Over the weekend it emerged Miley Cyrus was ‘dating’ singer Cody Simpson, not long after her split from Caitlynn Carter, which came not long after her split from Liam Hemsworth in August.

Which was nearly two months ago, may we add.

Because we can’t have nice things, she was immediately called out for, oh, we don’t know, managing to snag not one but two gorgeous people following the breakdown of her marriage.

Rightly calling out the double standards of the response to her being spotted kissing Cody, Miley took to Twitter to share some cold hard truths of modern times.

Posting a shot of her puckering up to Cody, she commented: ‘Can a girl not get a f**king acai bowl and a morning make-out session in peace?’

Hear hear!

That wasn’t all, though.

‘I know the public feels invested in my past relationship because they felt like they saw it thru from the beginning,’ she began. ‘I think that’s why people have always felt so entitled over my life and how I live it because they’ve watched me grow up.’

After her kiss with Cody was revealed, Miley spoke out (Picture: @mileycyrus)

‘But I am grown now and make choices as an adult know the truth/details/reality,’ she added, before getting to the good stuff.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘Men (especially successful ones) are RARELY sl*t shamed. They move on from one beautiful young woman to the next MOST times without consequence,’ she wrote.

‘They are usually references as “legends”, “heart throbs”, “G”, “Ladies Man” etc… where women are called sl*ts/wh*res!

‘I am just trying to THRIVE/survive in a “mans” world…if we can’t beat em, join em!

‘If our president can “grab em by the p*ssy…” can’t I just have a kiss and acai bowl?’

When it comes to a celebrity relationship, men arguably get the better end of the stick as they move on willy nilly (pardon the pun) after a relationship, whereas the likes of Miley and, say, Taylor Swift, are slammed as harlots.

So who has moved on fairly quickly (‘quickly’ being a subjective notion, of course) without so much as a second glance?

Leonardo DiCaprio

Leo is currently dating Camila Morrone (Picture: MEGA)

The actor seems pretty smitten with his girlfriend Camila Morrone now, however he has a long history of going from model to model, after he was seen with Nina Agdal not long before he was spotted with Camila.

Before that he was rumoured to have dated Rihanna, right after his split with Kelly Rohrbach. Before Kelly came Toni Garrn, Erin Heatheron and Blake Lively.

No hate to the guy, but when his romantic conquests are the punchlines of fancy awards shows, there is a double standard in how we treat relationship timelines.

The Weeknd

Advertisement

Advertisement

Not long after The Weeknd split with Bella Hadid he moved on pretty quickly with Selena Gomez (who, similarly, had recently split with Justin Bieber) in January 2017.

They dated for 10 months before they split and the singer rekindled with Bella.

All in all, people just wondered what kind of bangers he’d turn out by drawing upon the two relationships, rather than blasting him as they might his female contemporaries.

Pete Davidson

Pete didn’t get hate for moving on (Pictures: REX/GETTY)

Pete was flippin’ engaged to Ariana Grande before they split and he was seen on the arm of (and playing tonsil hockey with) Kate Beckinsale just months later.

But it was Ariana who copped the hate, after she split with Mac Miller and, in the eyes of fans, started dating Pete in quick succession.

Of course the sad death of Mac only served to suggest to some they needed to blame Ariana’s quick ‘rebound’ for Mac’s state even more so.

Keeping in mind Ariana has not been seen publicly with anyone since she split with Pete and he’s now had two public relationships (his latest with Margaret Qualley). But that’s neither here nor there.

Justin Timberlake

JT and Jess started dating a month after his split from Cameron (Picture: Getty Images)

Justin and wife Jessica Biel may appear as the beacon of what is good and wholesome when it comes to celebrity relationships, but you might not remember he had been in a long-term relationship with Cameron Diaz the month before he started dating Jessica in 2007.

Advertisement

After nearly four years JT and Cameron split in December of 2006, with the singer starting to date Jessica in January 2007.

No hate, Miley wouldn’t want that, but we’re just saying…

Nick Jonas

Sweet Nick is now married to Priyanka Chopra after a rather whirlwind engagement, but back in 2015 the singer was spotted with actress Kate Hudson in September, as they hung out at Disney World – just three months after he’d split from long-term girlfriend (and subject of his songs) Olivia Culpo.

Three months is a long time for some, sure, and Kate declined to confirm anything happened with Nick, but he was far from dragged by the haters for his move.

Liam Hemsworth

This pair has split before (Picture: Rex Features)

Speaking of Miley, her former husband Liam deserves a mention in here after he was seen kissing Eiza Gonzales the day after news of his first split with then-fiancee Miley hit in 2013.

Yeah, alright, we love Liam and Miley, but perhaps Miley was referencing the double standards afforded to her former husband after he was seen snogging a new woman the week they publicly split?

Fair play.

Ewan McGregor

After two decades, Ewan split from his wife Eve Mavrakis, which is sad all around.

However it soon emerged he was dating his Fargo co-star Mary Elizabeth Winstead in May 2017, as he addressed the breakdown of his marriage. He didn’t file for divorce from Eve until January 2018.

Wilmer Valderrama

Wilmer and Demi dated for six years (Picture: Rex Features)

That 70s Show’s Wilmer Valderrama dated pop star Demi Lovato for nearly six years, at times in that so-called on/off fashion, before they announced their split in June 2016.

Advertisement

Less than two months later, he was spotted with actor Minka Kelly, fuelling rumours he’d moved on.

While that union didn’t turn into anything, we don’t recall the social media dragging of Wilmer.

Special mention to Taylor Swift…

The Swift machine has long called out the double standards of society, after receiving hate for her dating life over the years.

She’s penned countless songs about it, including recent release The Man, which was cited by many a Miley fan after her weekend’s statement.

While she’s been in a relationship with actor Joe Alwyn for two years now, people still seem to not be able to get over the fact Taylor had a rather robust and thriving dating life in the years that preceded it.

A twenty-something living their best life? Male OR female? Ground breaking.

So let’s stop with the hate, eh? Remember, Judgey-Wudgey was a bear…
